newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Israel to raise 1.6 bln shekels/mth in June, July.
newsitem.headline: Israel to raise 1.6 bln shekels/mth in June, July.

text.p: The Israeli government plans to raise 1.6 billion shekels a month in June and July in the local bond market, the Treasury announced on Tuesday.
The Treasury has decided that from now on it will publish in advance a monthly programme for its bond auctions.
So far in June it has held three auctions, issuing 225 million shekels worth of bonds on June 2, 400 million on June 4 and 225 million on June 9.
The next auction, for 200 million shekels, will be held on June 16.
The Treasury said its monthly programme is based on forecast and is subject to change in accordance with the government's financing needs.
In the first five months of 1997 the government raised 9.16 billion shekels on the local bond market.
